name: codeup-web-exercises
description: * The unit of work in CSS is a rule     * One or several selectors.     * Declarations         * properties and values     * `selector { property: value; }` * Types of selectors     * Elements, classes, ids, pseudo-selector     * Combinations of them * There are 3 ways to include CSS in a page     * Inline. Using the `style` attribute     * Embedded. Using the `style` element     * External. Using the `link` element pointing to an external `.css` file * Types of positioning     * `static` is the default positioning     * `absolute` and `relative` positioning. Mostly used for images     * `fixed`. Mostly used in main navigation menus     * `float`. Is used mostly to create columns * There's 3 main font families     * Serif     * Sans serif     * Monospace * How to use Google fonts     * Select a font     * Add a link element in your HTML pointing to the font you selected     * Use the font family in your CSS rule
